title: Lily Allen and David Harbour (A.K.A. Hopper from 'Stranger Things') Kiss At Basketball Game
text:
From ELLE

Celebrity relationships we didn't see coming in 2019: Miley Cyrus and Cody Simpson, Pete Davidson and Kate Beckinsale, and now, it's time to add to the list, David Harbour and Lily Allen.

Yes, a new relationship has unfolded which has left us very excited. The Stranger Things actor and British singer have been spotted together on several occasions over the past few months, most recently with Allen supporting Harbour as he hosted Saturday Night Live this weekend.

Allen separated from her boyfriend Meredith Dan at the start of 2018, telling Elizabeth Day on her How To Fail podcast that she was single for the first time 'since I was about 15'. Harbour, who plays beloved character Hopper in the Netflix sci-fi series, was most recently linked to actress Alison Sudol.

Photo credit: Bertrand Rindoff Petroff - Getty Images More

It's not known for sure when these two started dating but, before we get to how they took their relationship up a notch this weekend, here's a brief recap of what we do know about the couple so far, starting with the most recent sighting:

October 18, 2019: Lily Allen and David Harbour attend basketball game

A day after making their red carpet debut at a charity gala, Allen and Harbour enjoyed some downtime at a basketball game in New York City.

The couple sat courtside to watch the New York Nicks take on the New Orleans Pelicans at Madison Square Garden and looked very comfortable, tactile and affectionate with one another.

Photo credit: James Devaney - Getty Images More

The singer - who looked chic in ripped jeans, boots and a jumper with a Peter Pan collar and actor shared kisses, cuddled up to one another, took some selfies and were seen laughing while watching the game.

Photo credit: James Devaney - Getty Images More
